III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4122 Resident and parent visitation.
Section (1) An institution shall provide for visits between each resident and
Description the resident's parents, unless parental rights have been
terminated, or the resident's record contains documentation that
visitation is detrimental to the resident.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth was approved for a home visit from 4/19/25-4/24/25 and
went home on 4/19/25. The youth did not want to remain in the
home and wanted to return to the facility, The facility refused to
obtain the youth. The youth was acting out behaviorally.
Investigation Interviews:
Mother was interviewed via phone on April 22, 2025. Mother
reported the facility had brought Youth A to her home on Friday,
April 18, 2025. Prior to this visit she reported there was a meeting
held with herself, Foster Care Worker, and the facility. The safety
plan created noted if Youth A was to go back to the facility, she
was to call the facility first and the On-Call MDHHS Worker for
transportation back. She reported Youth A had brought his gaming
system to her home and the plan was for him to keep it at her
home instead of at the facility. Mother reported Youth A got upset
because his brother was going to a birthday party at a trampoline
park and Mother could not afford to allow Youth A to go. She
reported Youth A began stating he wanted to sell his gaming
system to get money to go which she told him he was not allowed
to do. Mother reported she was able to get Youth A to calm down
and he went to bed for the night. She reported the next morning,
April 19, 2025, Youth A continued to be fixated on wanting to sell
his gaming system. Mother reported Youth A continued to
escalate, walked out of the home, and reported that he wanted to
go back to the facility. She reported she had called the facility and
asked them to come pick him up due to his behavior. Mother
reported she could not remember who she talked to but the
person at the facility told her they could not come to pick him up
because the plan was for his Foster Care Worker to transport him
Monday, April 21, 2025, back to the facility. The facility also told
her to contact the police as he had run away from the home or
showing unsafe behaviors. Mother confirmed her home is about
an hour and a half to two hours away from the facility. She
reported she did call the foster care on-call team for support as
well but by the time she got a hold of anyone, Youth A was able to
de-escalate and stay the rest of the visit. Mother reported the
facility did call her back and confirmed they could not transport
2

Youth A back to the facility and this would fall on the foster care
on-call team. She reported Foster Care Worker did provide the on-
call team phone number for emergencies which she did contact as
well but could not get through right away. Mother reported she has
never had an issue before on a visit with Youth A where he was
requesting to go back to the facility. She verified again she could
not remember who she spoke to at the facility and stated she had
never had any issues with the facility prior but was just calling for
support. Mother verified the facility does help with transport for
visits.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via phone on April 23,
2025. Foster Care Worker reported the facility transported Youth
A to his weekend home visit on Friday, April 18, 2025. She
reported the plan was for her to pick him up on Monday, April 21,
2025, to transport him back to the facility. Foster Care Worker
reported before this weekend's visit a Family Team Meeting was
held with Mother, herself, and the facility to speak about a safety
plan for the weekend. She reported due to distance and staffing
the facility would not be able to pick up Youth A from Mother’s
home if he had a crisis on Saturday or Sunday. Foster Care
Worker reported the plan was for Mother to contact the facility first
to check and then call On-Call MDHHS Worker for support. She
reported Mother was aware the facility would most likely be unable
to transport him back to the facility during the weekend. Foster
Care Worker reported she has no concerns with the facility, and
they have been assisting with transporting Youth A to visits.
On-Call MDHHS Worker was interviewed via phone on April
23, 2025. On-Call MDHHS Worker reported she was aware of the
safety plan for Youth A over the past weekend and the possibility
of her potentially needing to transport him back to the facility if
there were any concerns. She reported she did receive a phone
call from Mother on Saturday, April 19, 2025, but Youth A was
able to calm down and remain at the home.
Case Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility on
April 23, 2025. Case Manager reported Foster Care Worker is the
person to put visits in place for Youth A. He reported a safety plan
was put into place for the weekend visit of April 18, 2025, to April
21, 2025, to make sure Mother felt equipped to handle Youth A’s
behaviors. Case Manager reported it was noted that the facility
would not be able to pick up Youth A on April 19 or April 20 of
2025. He reported it was agreed upon that Mother, would call On-
Call MDHHS Worker if Youth A was unsafe and able to be
transported back to the facility before the visit was scheduled to
3

end on April 21, 2025. The plan was for Foster Care Worker to
transport Youth A back to the facility on April 21, 2025.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on April 24, 2025. Staff 1
reported she was the person who received the phone call from
Mother on April 19, 2025. She reported that Mother reported
Youth A was acting up at her home and she did not know what to
do. Staff 1 reported she guided Mother in setting guidelines for his
coping skills and with Youth A. She reported she offered to speak
with Youth A on the phone, but Mother reported he had just
walked out of the home. Staff 1 reported she told Mother she
needed to contact the police if he left her home, and she did not
know where he was. She reported that Mother asked her to come
pick-up Youth A from her home and transport him back to the
facility. Staff 1 reported she told Mother that they could not do that
at this time due to not having the staff and Youth A reported
unsafe behaviors. She reported she guided Mother to contact the
On-Call MDHHS Worker as Foster Care Worker was the person
who was going to transport Youth A back. Staff 1 reported she
spoke with Shift Supervisor about the situation, and he attempted
to call Mother back but never got through to her.
Shift Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
April 23, 2025. Shift Supervisor reported he was working when
Staff 1 received a phone call from Mother on April 19, 2025. He
reported Mother stated Youth A had run out of the house and
wanted the facility to come to pick up Youth A. Shift Supervisor
reported he told Staff 1 to inform Mother that she needed to
contact the police due to him running from the home and showing
unsafe behaviors. He reported Mother’s home is about an hour
and forty minutes from the facility. Shift Supervisor reported Foster
Care Worker was transporting Youth A back to the facility on April
21, 2025. He reported the On-Call MDHHS Worker would need to
be contacted to also help with support. Shift Supervisor reported
Staff 1 tried to coach Mother through the situation and explained
even if the facility were to transport him back it would not be safe
due to the behaviors she is reporting he is showing. Shift
Supervisor reported he did attempt to call Mother back to follow up
and left a voicemail but never heard back from her.
Youth A was not interviewed within this investigation as he
was not aware of Mother contacting the facility. This
consultant also did not want to trigger any more behaviors
over the situation that occurred. Youth A’s interview would
not change the outcome of this investigation.
4

Documents Reviewed:
- Youth A’s MiSACWIS case file- There was a social work
contact/ family team meeting on 04/08/2025 which noted
the safety plan for Youth A during weekend over night
visits. The plan was for parents to call the facility first to see
about getting help and if they are not available then to call
the MDHHS On-Call phone number for support. It was
noted the facility would not be able to transport Youth A
back to the facility on April 19, 2025, or April 20,2025. Case
Manager was present for this meeting.
- Youth A’s Safety Plan dated 04/8/2025- This safety plan
was created by Foster Care Worker and provided to Case
Manager and Mother. The safety plan is for Youth A’s
parents to utilize when he is on a home visit away from the
facility. The safety plan notes that the On-Call MDHHS
Worker needs to be contacted when behaviors are
escalated.
- Facility Fill in Sheet dated 04/19/2025- Under Youth A’s
section, Shift Supervisor noted Youth A was on a home
visit and Mother called the unit to see if the facility would
pick Youth A early. Staff 1 had told Mother it was not
possible and that the staff could not approve of that
because Foster Care Worker set this up. Mother had
reported Youth A ran from her home and she did not know
when he was staff. Staff 1 had directed her to call the police
for support. Shift Supervisor did follow up with a check-in
call, but did not receive any contact.
- Facility Residential Client Communication and Visitors
Procedures Effective date 07/02/2024- Youth are allowed
visits per their treatment plan with approval from their
primary funding source. The facility is to coordinate within
this plan.
- Email from Administrator dated 04/23/2025- The
Administrator sent the following clarification email as it
pertains to the policies surrounding the visitation policies at
the facility; “The policies surrounding visitation and home
visits are more at a broader level. As far as case by case,
it’s really the foster care worker/team that dictates
visitations and who/how/when/ etc. for visits. As for Youth
A’s case we follow the foster care guidelines for family
5

involvement as directed by his primary worker. We then
work within the contract language of working together with
MDHHS for permanency/family connection.”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Case Manager participated
in a Team meeting on 04/08/2025 prior to the weekend visit. It
was determined at that time the facility would transport Youth A to
the visit and Foster Care Worker would transport him back to the
facility. The safety plan noted that Mother was to contact On-Call
MDHHS for support including transportation. The facility did
provide Mother coping skills and directions of how to help handle
the situation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
